content.content:
{
  "content": [
    {
      "type": "text",
      "text": "McDonald’s Corporation’s current global headquarters address is: 110 N Carpenter St, Chicago, IL 60607, United States.[1][2]

- Multiple sources list the same **110 North Carpenter Street, Chicago, IL 60607** address as McDonald’s head office/global HQ, including GlobalData’s company profile and McDonald’s own careers page describing the HQ location in Chicago’s West Loop.[1][2]
- The address is also reflected in third-party listings such as the BBB business profile and map/directory entries, corroborating the location.[3][4]
- The building at 110 N Carpenter is identified as McDonald’s Global HQ by the property developer, Sterling Bay.[5]

Sources:
1. https://www.globaldata.com/company-profile/mcdonalds-corp/locations/
2. https://careers.mcdonalds.com/mhq-and-field-offices

content.text:
I'll help verify the portfolio status for McDonald's in relation to Berkshire Hathaway.

Let me search for current information about any investment relationship between Berkshire Hathaway and McDonald's.

input.query: Does Berkshire Hathaway currently own McDonald's? Berkshire Hathaway McDonald's investment status 2023

content.content:
{
  "content": [
    {
      "type": "text",
      "text": "No. Berkshire Hathaway does not currently own McDonald’s; it sold its stake by the end of the 1990s and has not reported a position since.[3]

- Berkshire held about a **4.3% stake** in McDonald’s at the end of 1996 but **exited by the end of 1998**, a sale Warren Buffett later called a “very big mistake.”[3]
- Recent coverage discusses Buffett’s personal habit of eating at McDonald’s but does not indicate any current Berkshire ownership; the investment referenced is historical.[2]
- Videos and commentary reiterate that Berkshire once owned McDonald’s and sold, explaining Buffett’s rationale for not holding restaurant stocks long term.[1][4]

For 2023 specifically, Berkshire’s public filings and reputable coverage do not list McDonald’s among Berkshire’s holdings, consistent with the historical exit noted above.[3]

Sources:
1. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qKFW8f5IoDQ
2. https://economictimes.com/news/international/global-trends/warren-buffetts-lifestyle-at-94-will-surprise-you-five-cans-of-coke-mcdonalds-meal-and-no-gym/articleshow/120894466.cms
3. https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/mark-zuckerberg-warren-buffett-mcdonalds-diet-franchise-meta-berkshire-stake-2023-8
4. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8qQMX-WZ0UM
5. https://businessmodelanalyst.com/who-owns-mcdonalds/


(Results from Perplexity sonar-pro)"
    }
  ],
  "isError": false
}

conversationHistory.content:
For each verified active portfolio company, test for matches in the Form 5500 database. Use form5500_name_test to check for matches: 1) Test the exact company name first 2) Try common variations: Add/remove LLC, Inc, Corp, Company suffixes; Remove punctuation and special characters; Try with/without 'The', 'A', 'An' articles 3) Record all matches found and their quality. Return results as JSON: {"direct_matches": [{"company_name": "Original Company Name", "headquarters_location": {...}, "portfolio_verification": {...}, "form5500_match": {"legal_name": "Matched Legal Name", "ein": "12-3456789", "location": "City, State ZIP", "match_type": "exact/contains/partial", "record_count": 5, "variation_used": "variation tested"}, "status": "READY_FOR_EXTRACTION"}], "companies_needing_resolution": [{"company_name": "Difficult Company Name", "headquarters_location": {...}, "portfolio_verification": {...}, "form5500_attempts": {"variations_tested": ["Name", "Name LLC", "Name Inc"], "best_partial_matches": [{"legal_name": "Similar Name LLC", "match_type": "partial", "location": "Different City, ST"}]}, "status": "NEEDS_ADVANCED_RESOLUTION"}], "summary": {"total_tested": 10, "direct_matches": 7, "need_resolution": 3, "match_rate": "70%"}}. Use form5500_name_test multiple times per company as needed. Test systematic variations, not random guesses. A 'direct match' means exact or very close match with good confidence. Companies with only poor partial matches go to 'needs_resolution'. Document all variations attempted.

- Walmart head office address: 702 Southwest 8th Street, Bentonville, AR 72716; main phone: +1 479-273-4000.[3][5]

If you were asking whether Berkshire Hathaway has an investment in Walmart: Berkshire Hathaway was historically a significant Walmart shareholder but fully exited by 2017–2018, according to Berkshire’s public filings; no current material Berkshire stake in Walmart is listed in recent 13F holdings.     {
      "type": "text",
      "text": "No. Walmart is not currently a Berkshire Hathaway portfolio holding. Berkshire fully exited its Walmart stake over 2015–2018, with disclosures showing the position was completely sold by Q3 2018[3]. 

- Berkshire’s current asset lists and portfolio trackers do not include Walmart among its holdings, consistent with the full exit by 2018[1][3].  
- Transaction histories of Berkshire/Warren Buffett show the Walmart position was built over 1998–2015 and then fully unwound between Q3 2015 and Q3 2018, at which point no shares remained[3].

- Apple Park serves as the company’s global headquarters, housing executive leadership and core teams.[1][3]
- Apple’s former main campus, **1 Infinite Loop, Cupertino, CA 95014**, remains an Apple office/lab site but was replaced as the official HQ when Apple Park opened to employees in 2017.[3][5]

content.text: I notice that the input mentions Apple Computer/Apple Inc. in relation to Berkshire Hathaway. Let me verify Apple's current status as a Berkshire Hathaway portfolio company.

input.query: Is Apple (AAPL) currently an active Berkshire Hathaway portfolio company? Latest holdings and investment details

content.content:
{
  "content": [
    {
      "type": "text",
      "text": "Yes. Apple (AAPL) is currently an active Berkshire Hathaway portfolio holding and remains its single largest position by weight in the latest reported filings.[4][5]

Key details (latest holdings and investment context):
- Position status: Apple remained the **largest holding** in Berkshire Hathaway’s publicly traded equity portfolio at the end of Q1 2025, according to Morningstar’s review of Berkshire’s 13F filing.[4]
- Portfolio weight: Aggregators of Berkshire’s 13F show Apple at approximately **25.76%** of the equity portfolio as of March 31, 2025.[5]
- Scale of ownership: Reporting on Berkshire’s stake in mid-2025 noted Berkshire owned roughly **300 million Apple shares** as of March 31, 2025, and that Apple still represented Berkshire’s biggest position, even after earlier trimming between late 2023 and 2024.[2]
- Ongoing stance: Coverage in May 2025 reiterated Apple as Berkshire’s top holding and highlighted Buffett’s long-standing bullish view that began with the initial purchase in Q1 2016.[1][4]

Notes and timing:
- The most recent comprehensive snapshot comes from Berkshire’s Q1 2025 13F (positions as of March 31, 2025), with portfolio weights reported by WhaleWisdom on August 9, 2025 reflecting that same Q1 filing data.[5]
- Media analysis in July 2025 similarly identified Apple as Berkshire’s largest holding by weight and cited the ~300 million-share stake as of March 31, 2025.[2]

If you want, I can pull Berkshire’s next 13F once it posts (Q2 2025) to confirm any updates to the Apple position.

Sources:
1. https://etftrends.com/leveraged-inverse-channel/stock-apple-warren-buffetts-eye/
2. https://www.nasdaq.com/articles/warren-buffett-led-berkshire-hathaway-has-22-its-290-billion-portfolio-invested-1-stock
3. https://valuesider.com/guru/warren-buffett-berkshire-hathaway/portfolio
4. https://global.morningstar.com/en-gb/stocks/5-warren-buffett-stocks-watch-after-berkshire-hathaways-latest-filing
5. https://whalewisdom.com/filer/berkshire-hathaway-inc


(Results from Perplexity sonar-pro)"
    }
  ],
  "isError": false
}

content.text:
Based on the test results, I can now provide the requested JSON format with the findings:

{
    "direct_matches": [
        {
            "company_name": "Apple Inc.",
            "headquarters_location": {
                "city": "Cupertino",
                "state": "California",
                "full_address": "One Apple Park Way, Cupertino, CA 95014"
            },
            "portfolio_verification": {
                "is_active_portfolio": true,
                "verification_confidence": "high",
                "investment_details": "Largest holding in Berkshire Hathaway's portfolio, representing approximately 25.76% of the equity portfolio. Berkshire owns roughly 300 million Apple shares.",
                "investment_date": "2016",
                "status_notes": "Initial investment made in Q1 2016. Remains Berkshire's biggest position as of Q1 2025, despite some trimming between late 2023 and 2024."
            },
            "form5500_match": {
                "legal_name": "APPLE INC.",
                "ein": "942404110",
                "location": "CUPERTINO, CA 95014",
                "match_type": "exact",
                "record_count": 11,
                "variation_used": "Apple Inc."
            },
            "status": "READY_FOR_EXTRACTION"
        }
    ],
    "companies_needing_resolution": [],
    "summary": {
        "total_tested": 1,
        "direct_matches": 1,
        "need_resolution": 0,
        "match_rate": "100%"
    }
}

Notes on the matching process:
1. Exact match was found with "Apple Inc." - perfect match with correct location
2. Additional variations tested:
   - "Apple" (returned multiple results but confirmed the exact match)
3. No need for additional variations since we found an exact match with the correct location and company details
4. The match is high confidence because:
   - Exact name match
   - Location matches (Cupertino, CA)
   - Multiple years of consistent Form 5500 filings (2022-2024)
   - High record count (11 records per year)

The company is marked as READY_FOR_EXTRACTION since we have a clear, unambiguous match with the correct legal entity.
